entry.para: b 207 kPa (30 psi) until MPH reaches 5 km/h (3 mph)
c Clutch Applied Through Manual Valve Position
b 207 kPa (30 psi) until MPH reaches 5 km/h (3 mph)
c Clutch Applied Through Manual Valve Position

note.para: Refer to the Transmission Vehicle Harness Connector illustration preceding these pinpoint tests.
Refer to the Internal Harness Connector illustration preceding these pinpoint tests.
Read and record all DTCs. All TR-P Sensor, PCA (line pressure solenoid) and VSS DTCs must be repaired before entering Output State Control (OSC) - Service Bay Mode.
Use the PID Chart for available diagnostic PIDs. Refer to Output State Control (OSC) Mode in this section.

item.para: Key in OFF position.
Select PARK.
Check to make sure the transmission harness connector is fully seated, terminals are fully engaged in connector and in good condition before proceeding.
Connect the diagnostic tool.
Engine idling.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Tool Box.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Data Logger.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Module.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: TCM.
Monitor the appropriate PID for the solenoid SSPC-x (#) or TCC (#) being tested, refer to the PID chart in Output State Control (OSC) Mode.

para.emph: Can the PIDs be monitored or solenoids be commanded?

entry.para: REMAIN in TCM Mode. GO to A2.
REPEAT procedure to enter TCM. If the vehicle did not enter TCM, INSTALL a new transmission control module (TCM).

item.para: Monitor the appropriate commanded current and pressure PID(s) for the solenoid being tested.
Select the appropriate active solenoid that is to be tested, SSx (#) or TCC (#).
Select activate icon.
Select (+) or (-) to increase or decrease the solenoid signal.
Select another value by using the (+) or (-) to increase or decrease the solenoid signal.
To cancel and return to normal operation press the activate icon.

para.emph: Do the monitored pressure and current readings change and match the command?

entry.para: CLEAR DTCs. Road test. If symptom persists, REFER to Diagnosis By Symptom in this section.

item.para: Disconnect the transmission vehicle harness connector from the transmission bulkhead connector.
Inspect the harness connector for damaged pins.
Key in ON position
Measure the voltage between the appropriate power pins on the harness side.

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST for normal operation.

item.para: Disconnect vehicle wire harness connector from TCM.
Carry out a continuity check between the appropriate transmission connector signal pin and TCM connector signal pin on vehicle harness side.
Check the appropriate signal wire for shorts to ground.

para.emph: Is there shorts or opens in the vehicle wire harness signal lead?

entry.para: REPAIR open or short in the harness.

item.para: Drain the transmission fluid.
Remove the transmission fluid pan.
Disconnect: Affected Solenoid
Measure the resistance between pins 1, 3, 4, 5, 8, 10 and 12 transmission bulkhead side and pin 2 at each associated solenoid connector.
Measure the resistance between pins 7, 20 and 24 transmission bulkhead side and pin 1 at each associated solenoid connector.

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 0.5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new harness. GO to A7.

para.emph: A6 CHECK FOR A SHORT TO GROUND

item.para: Measure the resistance between pins 1, 3, 4, 5, 8, 10 and 12 harness side and ground.

para.emph: Is the resistance greater than 10,000 ohms?
A7 CHECK THE SOLENOID RESISTANCE AT THE SOLENOID

item.para: Measure the resistance between pins 1 and 2 at each solenoid.

entry.para: INSTALL a new solenoid if not within specification. CLEAR the DTCs. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A8 CHECK THE SOLENOID FOR A SHORT TO GROUND

item.para: Measure the resistance between pins 1 and 2 at each solenoid and ground.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new TCM. If the condition persists, REFER to Diagnosis By Symptom in this section for diagnosis of pressure concerns. CLEAR the DTCs. TEST the system for normal operation.

note.para: Refer to the Transmission Vehicle Harness Connector illustration preceding these pinpoint tests.
Refer to the Internal Harness Connector illustration preceding these pinpoint tests.
Use the PID Chart for available diagnostic PIDs. Refer to Output State Control (OSC) Mode in this section.

table.title: PINPOINT TEST B: TRANSMISSION FLUID TEMPERATURE (TFT) SENSOR

item.para: Key in OFF position.
Select PARK.
Check to make sure the transmission harness connector is fully seated, terminals are fully engaged in connector and in good condition before proceeding.
Connect the diagnostic tool.
Key in ON position.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Tool Box.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Data Logger.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Module.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: TCM.
Monitor the appropriate PID for the TFT sensor.

entry.para: REMAIN in TCM. GO to B2.
REPEAT procedure to enter PID. If the vehicle did not enter PID, INSTALL a new transmission control module (TCM).

item.para: While monitoring the TFT PIDs, carry out the following test: If transmission is cold, operate to warm it up. If transmission is warm, allow transmission to cool down.

para.emph: Do the TFT PIDs increase as the transmission is warmed up or decrease as the transmission is cooled or does the TFT drop in and out of range?

entry.para: If the TFT PIDs increase as the transmission is warmed or decrease as the transmission is cooled, CLEAR all DTCs. CARRY OUT the road test to verify if concern is still present. If concern is still present, REFER to Diagnosis By Symptom in this section to diagnose transmission overheating.

item.para: Disconnect: Transmission Harness Connector
Visually inspect all wires and connectors for damage.
Measure the voltage between pin 18 harness side and ground.

para.emph: Is the voltage between 4.5 and 5.5 volts?

entry.para: REPAIR an open or short in the harness. TEST the system for normal operation. If normal operation does not return, INSTALL a new TCM.

para.emph: B4 CHECK THE RESISTANCE OF THE TFT SENSOR

item.para: Measure the resistance between pins 18 and 22 at the transmission bulkhead body connector.
Record the resistance.
Resistance should be approximately in the following ranges:

entry.para: REFER to Diagnosis By Symptom in this section to diagnose an overheating concern.

para.emph: B5 CHECK THE INTERNAL HARNESS FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Drain the transmission fluid.
Remove the transmission fluid pan.
Disconnect: TFT Sensor Connector
Measure the resistance between the TFT sensor connector pin 1 and the transmission bulkhead connector pin 18.
Measure the resistance between TFT sensor connector pin 2 and transmission bulkhead connector pin 22.

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 0.5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new internal harness. GO to B7.

para.emph: B6 CHECK THE INTERNAL HARNESS FOR A SHORT TO GROUND

item.para: Measure the resistance between TFT sensor connector pins 18 and 22, and ground.

para.emph: Is the resistance greater than 10,000 ohms?
B7 CHECK THE RESISTANCE AT THE SENSOR

item.para: Measure the resistance between pins 1 and 2 at the TFT sensor.

entry.para: INSTALL a new TFT sensor. CLEAR the DTCs. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: B8 CHECK THE SENSOR FOR A SHORT TO GROUND

item.para: Measure the resistance between pins 1 and 2 at the TFT sensor connector and ground.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new TCM. CLEAR the DTCs. If the DTCs return, an overtemp condition may exist. REFER to Diagnosis By Symptom in this section.

note.para: Refer to the Transmission Vehicle Harness Connector illustration preceding these pinpoint tests.
Refer to the Internal Harness Connector illustration preceding these pinpoint tests.
Use the PID Chart for available diagnostic PIDs. Refer to Output State Control (OSC) Mode in this section.

table.title: PINPOINT TEST C: TRANSMISSION RANGE (TR-P) SENSOR

para.emph: C1 VERIFY THE DIAGNOSTIC TROUBLE CODES

item.para: Key in OFF position.
Select PARK.
Carry out On-Board Diagnostic Test.

para.emph: Are only TR-P DTC codes present?
C2 VERIFY THE SHIFT CABLE/LINKAGE ADJUSTMENT

item.para: Select DRIVE.
Connect the shift cable/linkage.
Verify that the shift cable/linkage is correctly adjusted. REFER to Automatic Transaxle/ Transmission External Controls.

para.emph: Is the shift cable/linkage correctly adjusted?

entry.para:
ADJUST the shift cable/linkage. REFER to Automatic Transaxle/ Transmission External Controls.
GO to C3.

para.emph: C3 CHECK THE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM OPERATION (START AND REVERSE)

item.para: Select PARK.
Key in START position.
Key in OFF position.
Select NEUTRAL.
Key in START position.
Select PARK.
Key in OFF position.
Select REVERSE.
Key in ON position.
Check the reverse lamp illumination.

para.emph: Does the engine crank in PARK and NEUTRAL? Do the reverse lamps illuminate?

entry.para: The problem is not in the TR-P. REFER to the Engine Operation and Maintenance Manual for further diagnosis of the starting system and reverse lamps.

para.emph: C4 CHECK THE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM OPERATION (TR-P AND TCM)

item.para: Key in OFF position.
Select PARK.
Check to make sure the transmission harness connector is fully seated, terminals are fully engaged in connector and in good condition before proceeding.
Connect the diagnostic tool.
Key in ON position.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Tool Box.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Data Logger.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Module.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: TCM.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: TR_DC and TR_FREQ.
Move transmission range selector lever into each gear and stop.
Observe the PIDs: TR_DC, and TR_FREQ.
Monitor PID: TR_FREQ.
Compare the PID: TR_DC to the TR-P Duty Cycle Chart.

para.emph: Is the PID: TR_FREQ in the range of 100 to 150 Hz? Is the PID: TR_DC in the TR-P Duty Cycle range? Does PID: TR_DC remain steady when the harness is wiggled, the sensor is tapped, or the vehicle is driven?

entry.para: The problem is not in the digital TR sensor system. REFER to Diagnosis By Symptom for additional diagnosis.
If TR_DC changes when wiggling the harness, tapping on the sensor or driving the vehicle, the problem may be intermittent. GO to C5.

para.emph: C5 CHECK THE TCM HARNESS CIRCUITS FOR OPENS

item.para: Key in OFF position.
Disconnect: Transmission TCM Connector
Disconnect: Transmission Bulkhead Connector
Measure the resistance between pin 15 of the transmission bulkhead connector harness side and the appropriate TR-P signal pin at the transmission TCM connector, harness side.
Measure the resistance between pin 17 of the transmission bulkhead connector harness side and the appropriate TR-P ground pin at the transmission TCM connector, harness side.
Measure the resistance between pin 21 of the transmission bulkhead connector harness side and the appropriate TR-P power pin at the transmission TCM connector, harness side.

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuits. CLEAR DTCs and REPEAT Quick Tests.

para.emph: C6 CHECK THE TCM HARNESS CIRCUIT FOR A SHORT TO GROUND OR POWER

item.para: Measure the resistance between pin 15 of the transmission bulkhead connector harness side and the appropriate pin at the TCM connector, harness side.
Measure the resistance between pin 17 of the transmission bulkhead connector harness side and the appropriate pin at the TCM connector, harness side.
Measure the resistance between pin 15 of the transmission bulkhead connector harness side and the appropriate pin at the TCM connector, harness side.
Measure the resistance between pin 1 of the transmission bulkhead connector harness side and the appropriate pin at the TCM connector, harness side.

para.emph: Are the resistances greater than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuits. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C7 CHECK THE INTERNAL HARNESS FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Drain the transmission fluid.
Remove the transmission fluid pan.
Remove the transmission fluid filter.
Connect the diagnostic tool.
Measure the resistance between pin 21 transmission bulkhead connector and pin 1 on the sensor.
Measure the resistance between pin 15 transmission bulkhead connector and pin 2 on the sensor.
Measure the resistance between pin 17 transmission bulkhead connector and pin 3 on the sensor and ground.

para.emph: Are the resistances greater than 0.5 ohms?
C8 CHECK THE NON-TCM INTERNAL CIRCUITS OF THE SENSOR

item.para: Measure the resistance between pins 1, 22 and 25 and ground.

para.emph: Are the resistances greater than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new TR-P sensor assembly. REFER to Digital Transmission Range (TR) Sensor in this section. CLEAR DTCs and RERUN the OBD Tests.

note.para: Refer to the Transmission Vehicle Harness Connector illustration preceding these pinpoint tests.
Refer to the Internal Harness Connector illustration preceding these pinpoint tests.
Use the PID Chart for available diagnostic PIDs. Refer to Output State Control (OSC) Mode in this section.

table.title: PINPOINT TEST D: TURBINE SHAFT SPEED (TSS), INTERMEDIATE SHAFT SPEED, AND OUTPUT SHAFT SPEED (OSS) SENSORS

item.para: Key in OFF position.
Select PARK.
Check to make sure the transmission harness connectors are fully seated, terminals are fully engaged in the connector and in good condition before proceeding.
Connect the diagnostic tool.
Key in ON position.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Tool Box.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Data Logger.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Module.
Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: TCM.
Select and monitor the appropriate PID for the suspected sensor(s): turbine shaft speed (TSS), intermediate shaft speed sensor or output shaft speed (OSS) sensor.

para.emph: Can you select and monitor the appropriate sensor(s)?

entry.para: Continue to monitor the suspect sensor(s). GO to D2.
REPEAT procedure to ENTER PID. If you cannot monitor the sensor(s) using the diagnostic equipment, INSTALL a new transmission control module (TCM).

item.para: While monitoring the appropriate sensor PID, drive the vehicle so that the transmission upshifts and downshifts through all gears.

para.emph: Does the TSS, intermediate shaft speed sensor, or OSS PID increase and decrease with engine and vehicle speed?

entry.para: If the TSS, intermediate shaft speed sensor, or OSS PID does not increase and decrease with engine and vehicle speed, the issue may be found with the vehicle harness, TCM, sensor or internal hardware. GO to D4.

item.para: While monitoring the appropriate sensor PID, drive the vehicle so that the transmission upshifts and downshifts through all gears.

para.emph: Is the TSS, intermediate shaft speed sensor, or OSS speed PID signal erratic (drop to zero or near zero and return to normal operation)?

entry.para: If the sensor signal is erratic, there may be an intermittent concern in the vehicle harness sensor or connector. GO to D4.
CLEAR all DTCs. RERUN the OBD Tests.

para.emph: D4 CHECK FOR SENSOR BATTERY VOLTAGE

item.para: Key in OFF position.
Disconnect: Appropriate Speed Sensor
Inspect for damaged or pushed out pins, corrosion or loose wires.
Key in ON position.
For OSS, measure the voltage between sensor connector pin 3 and ground.
For TSS/intermediate shaft speed sensor, measure the voltage between sensor connector pin 1 and ground.

para.emph: Are the voltages greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: Repair the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation. CLEAR all DTCs. RERUN the OBD Tests.

para.emph: D5 CHECK THE TCM HARNESS CIRCUITS FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Disconnect: Transmission TCM Connector From the TCM
For intermediate shaft speed sensor, measure the resistance between the appropriate pin at the transmission TCM connector, harness side and the sensor connector pin 4, harness side.
For TSS, measure the resistance between the appropriate pin at the transmission TCM connector, harness side and the sensor connector pin 3, harness side.
For intermediate shaft speed sensor/TSS, measure the resistance between the appropriate pin at the TCM connector, harness side and the sensor connector pin 1, harness side.
For intermediate shaft speed sensor/TSS, measure the resistance between the appropriate pin at the TCM connector, harness side and the sensor connector pin 22, harness side.
For OSS, measure the resistance between the appropriate pin at the TCM connector, harness side and the sensor connector pin 1, harness side.
For OSS, measure the resistance between the appropriate pin at the TCM connector, harness side and the sensor connector pin 3, harness side.
For OSS, measure the resistance between the appropriate pin at the TCM connector, harness side and sensor connector pin 2, harness side and ground.

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the open circuits. TEST the system for normal operation. CLEAR all DTCs. RERUN the OBD Tests.

para.emph: D6 CHECK THE TCM HARNESS CIRCUITS FOR A SHORT TO GROUND

item.para: Disconnect: Transmission TCM Connector From TCM
Measure the resistance between TSS/intermediate shaft speed sensor connector pins 1, 2, 3 and 4 and ground.
Measure the resistance between OSS sensor connector pins 1, 2 and 3 and ground.

para.emph: Are the resistances greater than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the short circuits. TEST the system for normal operation. CLEAR all DTCs. RERUN the OBD Tests.

para.emph: D7 CHECK THE RESISTANCE OF THE TSS, INTERMEDIATE SHAFT SPEED SENSOR OR OSS SENSOR

item.para: Disconnect the appropriate vehicle harness connector from the TSS, intermediate shaft speed sensor or OSS sensor.
Measure the resistance between pins 3 and 2 for the OSS sensor.
Measure the resistance between pins 2 and 4 for the intermediate shaft speed sensor.
Measure the resistance between pins 2 and 3 for the TSS sensor.
Record the resistance. Resistance should be as follows:

para.emph: Is the resistance within specification for the appropriate sensor?

entry.para: INSTALL a new sensor. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: D8 CHECK THE SENSORS FOR A SHORT TO GROUND

item.para: Measure the resistance between pins 2 and 1, 3 and ground for the OSS sensor.
Measure the resistance between pins 2 and 1, 4 and ground for the intermediate shaft speed sensor.
Measure the resistance between pins 2 and 1, 3 and ground for the TSS sensor.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new sensor. TEST the system for normal operation.

caution.para: This test should only be used if DTCs P0748, P0960, P0962 or P0963 are present.

note.para: Refer to the Transmission Vehicle Harness Connector illustration preceding these pinpoint tests.
Refer to the Internal Harness Connector illustration preceding these pinpoint tests.

table.title: PINPOINT TEST E: PC-A (LINE PRESSURE) SOLENOID

para.emph: E1 CHECK VEHICLE HARNESS FOR CONTINUITY

item.para: Key in OFF position.
Disconnect transmission control module (TCM) connector.
Inspect for damage or pushed out pins, corrosion or loose wires.
Disconnect vehicle harness from transmission, inspect for damage or pushed out pins, corrosion or loose wires.
Measure resistance between the appropriate pin at the transmission TCM connector, harness side and the signal pin 10 at transmission harness connector.
Measure resistance between the appropriate pin at the transmission TCM connector, harness side and the power pins 7, 20, and 24 at the transmission harness connector.

para.emph: Is each resistance less than 5.0 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR an open. RECONNECT all components. REPEAT Quick Test.

para.emph: E2 CHECK VEHICLE HARNESS FOR SHORTS TO POWER AND GROUND

item.para: Measure resistance between the appropriate pin at the transmission TCM connector, harness side and the power pins 7, 20, and 24.
Measure resistance between the appropriate pin at the transmission TCM connector, harness side and chassis ground.

para.emph: Is each resistance greater than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: SERVICE short circuit. RECONNECT all components. REPEAT Quick Test.

para.emph: E3 CHECK FOR TRANSMISSION INTERNAL HARNESS

item.para: Drain the transmission fluid.
Remove the transmission fluid pan.
Disconnect: Affected Solenoid
Measure the resistance between pin 10 transmission bulkhead side and pin 2 at the solenoid connector.
Measure the resistance between pins 7, 20 and 24 transmission bulkhead side and pin 1 at each associated solenoid connector.

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 0.5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new harness. RECONNECT all components. REPEAT Quick Test.

para.emph: E4 CHECK FOR A SHORT TO GROUND

item.para: Measure the resistance between pins 10 harness side and ground.

para.emph: Is the resistance greater than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new harness. RECONNECT all components. REPEAT Quick Test.

para.emph: E5 CHECK THE SOLENOID RESISTANCE AT THE SOLENOID

item.para: Measure the resistance between pins 1 and 2 at each solenoid.

para.emph: Is the resistance for PC-A solenoid between 5.08-5.80 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new solenoid if not within specifications. CLEAR the DTCs. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: E6 CHECK THE SOLENOID FOR A SHORT TO GROUND

item.para: Measure the resistance between pins 1 and 2 at each solenoid and ground.

para.emph: Is the resistance greater than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new TCM. If the condition persists. REFER to in this section for diagnosis of pressure concerns. CLEAR the DTCs. TEST the system for normal operation.
INSTALL a new solenoid. CLEAR the DTCs. TEST the system for normal operation.
